reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in September, during a tour of the Western Isles. It's not a cheap hotel, and the rooms that we saw had a kind of faded elegance to them, but the Lochboisdale is overall a good choice if you don't mind that the decor hasn't been updated for a while, or that at least half of the rooms don't have amazing views.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with great food & views

reviews.text: The staff are friendly and service is good. It has that casual air of being a family-run hotel, and isn't stuffy or pretentious. The hotel looks like an old Scottish hunting lodge, from the tartan carpeting in the public areas, to the leather sofas and wood panelling in the bar. It felt cosy and welcoming, and the dining room overlooked the bay - great for a lazy dinner, watching the sun go down.
reviews.title: A fantastic place, with great staff - IGNORE the bad reviews!

reviews.text: Bedrooms are decent enough - clean and tidy, and some have extra beds. We had a problem with our TV but managed to fix that without calling for help from reception. Where the hotel did set itself apart though was in the food: dinners are well cooked and portions huge, but not much went to waste from our plates! The only exception was the haggis - too bland for a Scottish palate but perhaps tailored to meet foreign tastes. Prices were very good for dinner on the islands, and although the rooms weren't exactly cheap, in comparison with most hotels we saw, were pretty good.
reviews.title: Hen Party Destination

reviews.text: A good option, if you don't want a B&B in the area. Also next door to the ferry terminal, if that's important.
reviews.title: The delights of coffee...

reviews.text: We stayed at this little gem for 2 nights in early August. On arriving and seeing the fantastic location with spectacular views and being welcomed by the friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever met, we instantly wished that we were staying for longer. In the two nights that we did stay we ate in the restaurant on both nights and the food was delicious and great value for money. In the day time the kids explored the grounds and had a great adventure. As a family we fished in the sea from the little port just outside the hotel and in the evening we watched from the restaurant as the sun went down over the sea. We had a thoroughly fantastic stay at this hotel and recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Old Hotel in the process of refurbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were to sum up in one word the 15 days my wife and I spent at the Lochboisdale Hotel recently it would be `SUPERB’. We had a fabulous time with Karen and Callum. Our room was well beyond our expectations, the food was excellent (diets had to begin on returning home) the girls who served at table were a delight and good to talk to. The hotel has a most welcoming and well stocked bar, where we enjoyed the friendship of locals, staff and other visitors alike. Perhaps it’s wrong to single out any one person for praise, but Joanne has to have a special mention – what a lovely lady. My wife and I celebrated our Ruby wedding anniversary while we were staying at the hotel and I have to put on record that the staff all helped to make it a very special day. Are we visiting the Lochboisdale Hotel again? You betcha we are – plans already in mind for next summer
reviews.title: What a lovely place to stay

reviews.text: Staying in Lochboisdale for a week, I had an evening meal in the hotel on most evenings. Over the past few years, the food had been a bit hit and miss, but this year, it was truly nice. Between my friend and I, we tried several of the main courses and a few starters. From the starter menu, the mussels in white wine and cream sauce were truly outstanding. Perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. From the main menu, the fish and chips, bacon-wrapped monkfish and the stuffed chicken stand out. While fish and chips is one of the most common dishes on menus in Scotland, so much can go wrong. Not here, though. The batter was crispy and gorgeous, the fish obviously fresh and the chips were nicely cooked. The monkfish had been cooked to perfection and came with potatoes and mixed vegetables - gorgeous. Similarly the chicken, absolutely fantastic. Nice food, friendly service - definitely recommedable!!
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly I feel that the hotel and staff were a let down for my £100 per night. I would suggest that potentialy the Hotel could be a great asset, but the lack lustre attitude of the staff and owners need some training in the hospitality field of business. I won't go into the problems I encountered as they vary from health and safety issues to bad housekeeping , needless to say the facilities and the general attitude of the people in the hotel would have been over priced at £50 per night. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.We have travelled to many Islands, to hotels that vary from 5 star to 2 star, and find that The Lochboisdale Hotel to be at the bottom of our list .Nevertheless we did not allow these problems to impact on our holiday.
reviews.title: Hospitality training required

reviews.text: I have never commented on a hotel before, but this was spectacular. If you had to design the worst possible experience you would win an award with this gem. If someone forced open the door on an abandoned army barracks and bought food from a passing tramp they'd make a better job of it. Having read the publicity about choosing your lobster from a boat in the harbour I had to laugh. The "local" produce consisted of curry, Thai curry, pasta, and best of all, nachos. Look out also for the " BROCILLI SOOP" on the menu, a modern twist on an old classic.The room was an exercise in neglect. The counterpane had blood on it, the wallpaper was damp and peeling off the wall and on opening the "curtains" to take in the view I was met by a flat pitch roof with a snarling dog baring it's teeth at me. Truly magnificent. In short, run away and keep running.
reviews.title: welcome to hell

reviews.text: enjoyed every minute of it good food, good service and good crack in the bar with the locals very welcoming people. the rooms are clean and comfortable with free sat . so all in all very enjoyable stay
reviews.title: excelent
All that is bad about Scottish hotels ...!
reviews.text: Even the front door suggested at things to come, the handle being loose, uncared for and the door difficult to close. We were not greeted at reception, rather rang the bell several times before going off to look for someone. The reception itself is very unprofessional with piles of old ringbinder folders lying around the floor behind the desk. When someone eventually turned up, he did't have a record of our name, but gave me a key to a room. I asked where the room was - but he said he didn't know! Moreover, he couldn't be bothered finding out.

Having located the room, it was very tired, with poor, old decor. The en-suite bathroom was desparately in need of a makeover with old floor coverings and a hand held shower in a bath. The twin beds were fit for the rubbish dump with mattresses so worn and so indented that it looked like people were still lying in them. The decor in the bedroom itself was very tired, with wallpaper peeling off the wall in places. The room had an overall dingy, tired feel. It's the kind of room you endure rather than enjoy.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Time !
